definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: This is a narrow view of be worthy of the name.
sentences.chinese: 这是名副其实的一孔之见。

sentences.english: The above is only the power of the individual peep-hole view, thoughtful.
sentences.chinese: 以上只是个人的了一孔之见，权当抛砖引玉。

definition: the view of a frog in a well (idiom); fig. a narrow view
to just talk for the sake of talking
learned person/expert in a certain field/abbr. to 方家[fang1 jia1]
lit. a brick thrown to prompt others to produce a jade (idiom)/fig. a modest suggestion intended to prompt others to come forward with better ideas
to mention some but omit many others (idiom)/to leave out much more than one includes
lit. throw out a brick and get jade thrown back (idiom)/fig. to attract others' interest or suggestions by putting forward one's own modest ideas to get the ball rolling
to venture to/to presume to/to take the liberty of
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
